intro: Trautvetteria palmata f. occidentalis, commonly known as the western palmate trautvetteria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive, fern-like appearance. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for xeriscaping in arid landscapes.
